input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Liking spicy food has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Skill has a direct effect on occupation and salary. Occupation has a direct effect on salary. Skill is unobserved. Method 1: We look at how liking spicy food correlates with salary case by case according to occupation. Method 2: We look directly at how liking spicy food correlates with salary in general. To understand how liking spicy food affects salary, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
